title: Vue 2.0 perf in Weex

comments.body: This issue has been transferred to https://github.com/weexteam/weex-vue-framework/issues/2

body:
I tried Vue 2.0 as JS framework of Weex #113 and wrote some examples in `jsfm-feature-vue` branch which included syntax, showcase etc.

preparation:
1. run `npm ln vue` to https://github.com/alibaba/weex-vue-next/
2. run `npm ln weex-loader-new` to https://github.com/alibaba/weex-loader-next/
3. run `npm run build -- weex.common.js,weex.compiler.js` in `weex-vue-next`

build:
1. run `npm run dev` in `src/js-framework` folder in `weex`, the new JS framework will be built into `src/js-framework/dist/index.js`
2. run `webpack --config webpack.vue.config.js` in Weex, the Vue JS bundle files will be built into `example/build/vue/` folder

This new JS framework file will support both current Weex JS bundle and Vue JS Bundle.

I use this JS framework file to build an Android APK and run "List (Advanced)" example 5 times for each bundle type in Smartisan YQ601 Android 5.1.1 (坚果手机). Here is the perf result:

Vue: https://github.com/alibaba/weex/blob/88422ee8567bb946d87d465446137916ac9dd605/src/vue/examples/showcase/itemlist.vue

| bizType | pageName | templateLoadTime | localReadTime | JSLibInitTime | JSLibSize | templateUrl | JSTemplateSize | communicateTime | screenRenderTime | totalTime | JSLibVersion | WXSDKVersion | errCode | renderFailedDetail | errMsg |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| vue | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 23 | 291 | 757 | 756 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| vue | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 23 | 209 | 479 | 479 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| vue | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 23 | 279 | 730 | 729 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| vue | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 23 | 167 | 439 | 438 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| vue | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 23 | 176 | 592 | 591 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |

Weex: https://github.com/alibaba/weex/blob/88422ee8567bb946d87d465446137916ac9dd605/examples/component/list/list-demo.we

| bizType | pageName | templateLoadTime | localReadTime | JSLibInitTime | JSLibSize | templateUrl | JSTemplateSize | communicateTime | screenRenderTime | totalTime | JSLibVersion | WXSDKVersion | errCode | renderFailedDetail | errMsg |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| weex | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 43 | 499 | 367 | 569 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| weex | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 43 | 421 | 359 | 522 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| weex | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 43 | 514 | 414 | 582 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| weex | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 43 | 473 | 356 | 576 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |
| weex | WXPageActivity | 0 | 0 | 20277 | 0 |  | 43 | 516 | 365 | 583 | v0.13.9 | 1.5.0 |  |  |  |

The whole native log is here: [perf.zip](https://github.com/alibaba/weex/files/288452/perf.zip)

Seems the performance was not stable enough (still not get the reason). And the `screenRenderTime` (first-paint time) is just as same as the `totalTime` because Vue can only generate the whole virtual-DOM and mount it as last.
